name: The Hampton Inn Times Square North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in many NYC midtown hotels over the years, and I believe this hotel is the best choice for families and solo travelers. The rooms are huge by NYC standards. The hotel staff is cheerful and helpful. Check-in is fast, and the location is wonderful. We walked to Central Park, Lincoln Center, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Broadway and Off-Broadway theatres. The a/c is silent and not the type that has those noisy blowers. There is free wi-fi and complimentary breakfast (although the lines for breakfast are very long). The bathrooms are on the small side but are very clean. In fact the entire hotel was immaculate. Free coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and fruit are available all day in the lobby area. The hotel is near some excellent restaurants, and there is a grocery store nearby if you want to purchase things for your room. The beds are very comfortable, and the flat screen TVs also have a nice choice of channels. We did not use the concierge, but she was always assisting guests with suggestions for tickets and museums. The hotel is also near the ticket station if you wish to purchase tickets for the popular hop-on-hop-off tour buses.
reviews.title: Best choice in theatre district

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Hampton Inn Times Square North for a business trip. I booked this for a conference, with myself and 3 colleagues. Conference was on 6th Ave and 52nd, so the walk was only 10 minutes west. Free breakfast saved $$ for our group of 4. Nearby restaurants provided great variety, quick service, and ethnic diversity. Nearby Diners save us money for lunch or a quick dinner. Hotel was clean, front staff mostly helpful and very friendly. Concierge was able to handle all her requests. I did mine by phone. Would give her my requests and she would call me back with suggestions, and reservations. Bellman helpful when needed 430 am ride to airport for 4. Will definitely stay here again, for business or for pleasure, because it is located in Times Square area and close to theaters, Broadway, and subways stops to take you anywhere you want to go.
reviews.title: Book this hotel for business or pleasure

reviews.text: During our stay at the Hampton Inn during Memorial Day weekend, we encountered some of the best hotel staff, Especially Alonzo Jones and Eugene Harris. They were willing to go the extra mile for us and make sure we were happy. We enjoyed their hospitality and professionalism and we look forward to a return visit!
reviews.title: A perfect vacation and hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free breakfast, great location and comfortable rooms. Nothing at all can be said bad about this place. The only minor thing was 1 of the lifts was not working for a few days.
reviews.title: Excellent on all aspects.

reviews.text: For location and value this was the best we could find in NY, and we ledt there with no regrets. Highly recommend for any travel stay.
reviews.title: I was pleasantly surprised with the overall quality of this hotel.
Great Location - Great Price
reviews.text: This was my first trip to New York. I needed to book two rooms for 8 women. Booked this hotel not only on reviews that I viewed on the Trip Advisor website but also because of its location and price. Paid $201 plus tax for 4 people in a room w/AAA discount. Again, the location was wonderful - close to the theaters, City Sights bus tour. Also, the breakfast buffet served each morning was bountiful with good selections each day. There were also "Breakfast on the Go" bags available at the front desk if you didn't have time to eat in their dining room. The queen-sized beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and very quiet. If I had to put anything down that was a negative, it would be that the sink was in the bathroom which made it a juggling act to get four women ready in the morning. Again, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering staying in New York!

reviews.title: wonderful wonderful wonderful
reviews.text: I have stayed in a lot of NYC hotels, paid more, and got a lot less. Great location near theatres and Times Sq, friendly staff, free breakfast, 24 hour coffee, big clean rooms, parking attached, free internet access. You can pay $300+ a night somewhere else or stay at the HI Manhattan and get it for less.

reviews.title: The best location
reviews.text: This hotel has the best possible location, 8 Avenue between 51 & 52 street = one block from Broadway and the musical Mama Mia that we went to see! Rooms is very clean and not to small. Breakfast was included and was OK comparing with American standard (Not a healthy breakfast)

reviews.title: You will be pleased with this hotel, if not, then you are picky, picky, picky,
reviews.text: Restaurants in the neighbourhood: If you like Sushi don’t miss Bamboo 52 around the corner at 52 street. The Brewery House around the other corner is also excellent with American food and lots of draft beers.

reviews.title: Excellent Choice
reviews.text: My very best hotel stay in New York. I would definetly go back to the Hampton again. It started with a front desk staff that was very friendly and efficient. We arrived early and had to check our bags and the bell man was quick and friendly, gave me a subway map and got me on my way. The breakfast was excellent, good choices, the area was clean and well kept and the staff went out of their way to make breakfast a good start to the day. They walked around when they were free and asked if they could bring you coffee or juice, never had that happen.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel! The staff were pleasant and helpful whenever we needed them. The location of the hotel is perfect for the subway and within walking distance of the sites. The rooms are large, clean and well equipped. It's also reasonably priced. Highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Great Location with Best Service
reviews.text: I would like to recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Manhattan. The front desk officer, Joan, was very helpful and friendly upon check-in. This hotel comes with free brteakfast, snacks in the lobby, and 24 hrs Coffee and Hot Chocolate.

reviews.title: Awesome!!
reviews.text: Once we were late for breakfast, the desk officer immediately offered us packed snacks from the restaurant. Really great! Good Job.

reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more
reviews.text: I traveled to NYC with 2 friends for shopping and a Broadway play. I checked online reviews as I searched for a place for us to stay. The Hampton Inn had excellent reviews so I made reservations. Now I am back to add another excellent review to the list. I cannot say enough good things. All the staff was extremely accommodating. Even after we checked out of our room, the bellboy let us leave our luggage there because we had a late flight out and wanted to do some more shopping. When we came back to pick up our luggage, the bellboy had a taxi waiting for us to take us to the airport. The hotel was immaculate. The breakfast was awesome! Great selection!! Everyone was extremely friendly. The location is great. Just a couple of blocks from shopping and Broadway. I could say so much more but I think you get the picture.

reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: second visit to NYC and our second stay at this hotel - staff are friendly and helpful, breakfasts are basic but good (forget the comments about how busy it gets - just get up earlier!!), location is superb: central park five minutes, times square two minutes, subway at 50th street right across the road (as is the Gershwin theratre for Wicked). Lots of local restaurants (west 46th street has a great choice). I honestly can't see how you could ask for more from a hotel at this price in the centre of manhattan.

reviews.title: Convient location and good value for New York.
reviews.text: Comfortable hotel. Great beds. Large bathroom. Breakfast included. Close to Times Square, Central Park and theaters.

reviews.title: Free Internet, free breakfast and great hot chocolate
reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights in Room 222.

reviews.title: Highly recommended!
reviews.text: Although the hot cooked options at breakfast were nothing to write home about, there was always an endless supply of delicious cereals, fruits, fruit juice, bagels, cake, yoghurts, tea, coffee and of course hot chocolate!

reviews.title: Great hotel and friendly staff!
reviews.text: There was always somewhere to sit down for breakfast - we went down around 7.30am. We managed to sit at the same table everyday. It did get busy around 9am - but there is a sign on the door indicating when the busiest times are.

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.text: Tea, coffee and hot chocolate was always on tap downstairs in the foyer.

reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at the Hampton
reviews.text: We just got back Monday from the Hampton Inn Times Square. We can't complain about anything. This hotel had everything we needed. We requested a room on an upper floor overlooking 8th ave. and a bit quieter and they were happy to oblige. The service at the hotel was excellent. They always had a smile and were happy to answer any of our questions. The rooms are very spacious for a New York hotel. We had plenty of room, it even had a couch and coffee table along with a comfy bed and big window. The room was clean and we never experienced any bed bugs as previously mentioned in another post. We had plenty of towels and ammenties in the bathroom such as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and mouthwash were nice touches. The breakfast in the morning was great offering both hot and cold items. It was very convenient to have and we never had difficulty getting a spot even arriving between 9&10am. The location is excellent. We were within walking distance of broadway shows, times square, central park and shopping areas. There are some nice restaurants nearby. We enjoyed drinks a couple of nights at a lounge/restaurant called Thalia just down the road at 8th and 50th. Taxi cabs are readily available in front of the hotel or just ask the bellman. We also took the subway right down the street at 51st and once you know the route it can take you just about anywhere, We felt totally safe and it was great to have a stop nearby the hotel. The cost, location and service at this hotel are perfect for a any type of getaway to NYC and we highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Great Location, but beware Bed Bugs
reviews.text: Cheap, easy access to TSqaure & Bus tour.

reviews.title: Amazing location, great service
reviews.text: But watch out for the hidden dirt!

reviews.title: Nice and priceworthy hotel in NYC
reviews.text: Somehow I found myself on a bus trip to NY with a group of older ladies (I'm 36). We had several in the group with diabetes and other ailments. The staff accomodated every request they could possibly have had, and did so with a smile. They brought refrigerators to the rooms that needed them, provided extra ice buckets, extra blankets, etc. I left a post-it on our bathroom mirror requesting 8 towels each day (4 of us, 2 showers daily), and they were there every day thereafter.

reviews.title: Fantastic customer service, wonderful location, perfection!
reviews.text: Every staff member was smiling and helpful at every encounter. They could not seem to do enough to please you! Our large group (42, I think) took a bit of time to get all checked-in and room keys issued. So, they opened the breakfast area and provided us with cold water, cereal bars, muffins, etc. A wonderful welcome to NY after a 13 hour bus ride!

This hotel is very good but don't expect anything fancy. Check-in was professional but not particularly warm. Room had no view but was very quiet. Room was very clean but they failed to put toilet paper in our bathroom for 2 days in a row. Beds were very comfortable and the climate control system worked well. Breakfasts are nothing special but plentiful, clean and easy. Location is great especially if you want to be in the Theatre District. Good restaurants are nearby although we found Ray's Pizza across the street to be very mediocre but passable if you are too tired to go elsewhere. Overall, this is a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Nothing Fancy but a Good, Solid Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the perfect location, 2 blocks from Times Square, access to the underground\trains was just across the street, lots of restaurants and a couple of bars\pubs, and not far from the theater district...
reviews.title: Its all about location

reviews.text: We got the hotel late in the evening, the reception staff were ok but not friendly.
reviews.title: Value for money in New York

likes.disliked: — View and occasional rumble of the subway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was free tea and coffee in reception (which is avail 24/7).
reviews.title: An excellent hotel- Great service and location!!!!!

reviews.text: The room was very spacious, the bathroom was of a good size.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel
Fan of Hampton Inn-Times Square North
reviews.text: I was very pleased with this hotel. i spent lots of time researching a place to stay for my first trip to NYC. I went with the great recommendations of fellow Trip Advisor travelers. It was in a great location-easy walks to Broadway plays, 5th Avenue stores, and Central Park. I felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night as well. The hot breakfasts were great, the staff friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and bedding was very comfortable. It was also surprisingly quiet!! I was prepared for midnight door slams to wake me up or at least the next room to wake me with 6am shower sounds, BUT I never heard a thing! I will definitely stay there again and hope that the management and staff will be just as excellent.

reviews.title: Decent Digs
reviews.text: Decent digs. Good bang for the buck. Not so hot on conceierge, or common area, but room dandy, breakfast fine, great location. Fine for the money.

reviews.title: great location
reviews.text: great location for times square, subway, Broadway etc. nice rooms, great complimentary breakfast, would stay again.

reviews.title: Would stay there again in a New York Minute
reviews.text: Booked our trip through Orbitz after doing a lot of research on the internet and TripAdvisor. We arrived on Friday, Dec. 14th around noon. Our room was immediately ready and very clean. The room was very spacious for a NYC hotel room. The king bed was extremely comfortable. We overlooked 8th street and were not really bothered by noise level.

reviews.title: Basic Hotel in NYC - Ups & Downs - Depends on what your looking for..
reviews.text: Concierge was very helpful to steer us to closest subway entry, directions to theater, and help with shuttle back to airport. Each morning we were down for the breakfast ( around 9ish) that was included in our stay. We found it very satisfying and was well stocked. There are usually 2 hot items each morning with homemade biscuits. Also had cereals, pastries, cake, fresh fruit, breads, juice, and milk. Enjoyed the hot coffee and hot chocolate available all day long. We were just a block away from our theater show of Wicked and not a far walk to Radio City and all of the sights. We did a lot of walking while we were in NYC and found that the Hampton Inn Times Square North was very convenient for us. Would return in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel with an offer from Expedia at a great price. We saved over $500 by changing hotels from the Affinia 50.
reviews.title: What A Great Find

likes.disliked: — One member of staff was very rude

reviews.text: The locacton is excellent, the theaters we went to were right around the corner, the uptown subway is across the street and the downtown subway is just a block away, In addition Broadway is just a block away which gives you some additional subway choices.
reviews.title: Would stay here again
Everything you need
reviews.text: Checkout was smooth and quick and again the bellman checked our bags and was quick to call a cab for us.

Would I stay here again, YES, in A NEW YORK MINUTE. We normally stay in the Times Square area, this is the first time at this hotel but it wont be the last time. I reserved early and the price while higher than most Hampton Inns, it surely competitive for the New York Area. I am sure you can pay more but why would you want to.
reviews.title: Great Deal
LOVED IT, LOVED IT, LOVED IT !
reviews.text: We have stayed at three different hotels and locations in New York and this is by far the best.

reviews.title: Great Memorial Day Weekend!
reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful, the beds are to die for and the decor divine.

reviews.title: PERFECT!
reviews.text: Of course if yourve got the money to spend there would be endless options of fantastic places to stay in New York but if your looking for something reasonably priced that seems to give you better value than youd expect for your dollar, stay here.

reviews.title: so much more...
reviews.text: We travelled with children and had a quad room which was great. The only thing they dont seem to offer is a suite which would be great for families.

reviews.title: Convenient, Clean and Comfortable
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning is adaquete, saves you having to buy another meal out.
This is a brilliant hotel in a good location. We stayed for five nights 11-16 February and got back yesterday.
reviews.title: Great hotel - good location

reviews.text: The location itself is great - not far from Times Square, and handy for the subway. The rooms have lovely comfortable beds, are very spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hampton!

reviews.text: The breakfasts are great. and are included in the price. They have a cooked choice option eg egg and bacon, or egg and sausage and there was a choice of cereals, pastries, yoghurt and fresh fruit. We did not experience any problems finding a table, and were impressed at the selection. There are also 'Breakfast to Go' bags at reception if you are too late for breakfast or want breakfast 'on the run'. There are cookies and apples at reception during the afternoon and complimentary hot drinks 24/7 - hot chocloate, tea, coffee etc.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: I thought this was a geat hotel for the price and would definitely stay there again on my next visit to New York.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: Believe the reviews, this really is a fantastic hotel. We stayed for five nights at the beginning of February (when it was really cold!) and can't fault the hotel at all.
reviews.title: A+ : Great hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a reasonable, comfortable, approachable place to rest during your stay in NYC then look no further. This Hampton lives up to the chain's commitment to quality. Hampton Inns are admittedly not the place to stay if you are looking for a boutique hotel with a great restaurant. However this hotel is certainly easy to get to, has great beds, is in a fantastic place for tourists and offers breakfast for a price that is fair considering the locale.
reviews.title: Who could ask for anything more?

reviews.text: Getting to the hotel from the airport is easy even when using MTA. The staff is helpful (they will gladly allow you behind the desk to print boarding passes). The breakfast is at a level one would expect for a tourist class hotel. Overall, unless you are extremely style conscious or discerning to the point that dropping $700 a night for luxury is no problem, this hotel should meet your needs.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn NYC - Wonderful !

likes.liked: — The room, the pleasant attitude of the employees, the view of 8th & 51st streets from our room
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything we didn't like.

reviews.text: My family (husband, two teen daughters and I) just returned from a four day visit to NYC. We made our reservation via phone w/ the Hampton Inn based only on their ad, proximity to the city, and availability for the dates we were planning our visit. I didn't know what to expect as a first time visitor to NY. This hotel was top notch from the start. We arrived earlier than check-in time and they held our bags while we headed out to see the city. When we returned, our bags were delivered to our room within five minutes of our arrival there. The concierge, bellman, housekeeping and front desk people were consistently helpful and friendly. Any questions we posed were answered promptly, accurately, and with a smile. The room was very nice (including the restroom) and the beds comfortable. Hot coffee, hot chocolate and hot tea were available in the lobby hallway all day and into the evening. Most nights we returned to the hotel around 10-11:00 and stopped by for hot chocolate to take to our room. The day we checked out we had several hours between check-out time and flight time. Again, our bags were held while we left the hotel for about three hours. When we returned, the bellman had our bags on the cart and a taxi waiting for us at the door! His attitude was so pleasant and helpful and the service was beyond what we expected (I wish I had taken notice of this man's name - he was awesome).
reviews.title: Comfortable

likes.liked: — The food and tea extras and the comfy bed

reviews.title: great choice for NYC
reviews.text: The hotel is on 8th and 51st street - just around the corner or down the street from EVERYthing! Across the street is a fantastic Mexican food restaurant (Mi Nidito) and a Ray's pizza. Starbucks, a drug store (Walgreens?), a Food Emporium, and tons of other things were on the same block - as well as uptown and downtown subway stations. Theatres were within two blocks and Times Square just Right There! :)

You know how you like to have a nice hotel, but not so nice that you feel it's wasted when you're only there for a few hours to sleep ... ? We didn't feel this way at all. The rates were more than we normally pay on a vacation, but the room and the service were worth the price. At the same time, accomodations were not so ritzy that we felt like we were wasting money staying there. A wonderful hotel experience - a place we will recommend to friends and will visit again if we get the opportunity to return to NYC.
reviews.title: What a Deal!

likes.disliked: — The lobby was a little small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing Staff! Great Location! Wonderful Breakfast! Large and CLEAN room! What more can I say about this hotel? Upon arrival, we were greeted by a smiling helpful person who got us checked in in a matter of seconds. The room (on the 10th floor) overlooked 8th Avenue. Large room with two queen beds. 4 pillows per bed. The bathroom (although small, but not by NYC standards) was sparkling clean and well stocked with towels and other amenities. The location on 8th Avenue between 51st and 52nd is perfect for theater or walking to Central Park! One block from a subway station, the city is accessible. Breakfast in the morning...get there early if you want to avoid the crowds. Even with the crowds, the line moved quickly and the selection was varied and plentiful. Throughout the property we were greeted with smiles from staff. I can't imagine a better hotel for the money in Manhattan. Kudos to the Hampton Inn Times Square North!
reviews.title: The reviews don't lie!

reviews.text: Visited NYC during July 2010 for the first time. Wanted to spend money on NY experience rather than hotel and was happy with our choice. Consistent experience with other Hampton
reviews.title: Good across the board, especially location near theaters

reviews.text: Inn properties.
reviews.title: Excellent service, great attention to detail, made me and my wife feel very welcomed.

reviews.text: Good.....
reviews.title: Greatest place to stay in NYC

reviews.text: Great location theaters (1 min. Walk to Wicked, Jersey Boyes, Harry Connick Jr., etc)
reviews.title: Great location, great value, great time!

reviews.text: Wonderful location, super staff...always willing to help / advise guests. Gave the impression of a real team effort as managers would help out when breakfast area was busy,handing out muffins and juice to those waiting. Hot coffee always available in the lobby which was very welcome following a busy day sightseeing.
reviews.title: Super Hampton

reviews.text: We have been to New York on several vacations previously and have always stayed at The Salisbury. However, I would give The Hampton Inn the edge as the staff were outstanding, there was a little gym, the lobby coffee was a godsend and the breakfast was free.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: For hotel in NY and with reasonable price, this hotel room is ample, location is great and on top of it Free Breakfast and Internet.
reviews.title: This hotel is excellent!

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel twice and the rooms are big and clean. The hotel staff are wonderful. They go out of their way to help you. The free breakfast is wonderful. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. I highly recommend staying here!
reviews.title: Great Location and terrific Breakfast Bar

reviews.text: Family of 4 - Parents and 2 teenage daughters stayed for 4 nights. First visit to NYC. Had a grand time. Hampton was very convenient to everything. 1 block away from the Blueline subway. Less than ten blocks from 42nd St and Broadway. Near dining and drugstore for those after hours items. Six blocks south of Columbus Circle where there is an indoor mall with Whole Foods Market which has a GREAT food bar and only $7.99 by the pound. Lots of food for little dollars. The Hampton itself was very clean and organized. The complementary Breakfast Bar was outstanding serving till 10am. Crowded sure, but that was because it was delicious. Staff very friendly and everyone smiled all the time. We were on 2nd floor and it was surprisingly quite for being closer to the street. No or little traffic noise at all. Would stay there again and recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice Hampton Inn. Being at the northern edge of the theater district means this hotel is a little quieter than many. Bathrooms are small but attractive. The 11th floor--the highest level--is a full floor of king, non-smoking rooms. Comfy mattress. Plumbing noise through the walls, but not much else. (The busload of high school kids were housed on the 2nd floor--not sure how noisy that got!) Rooms face either 8th Avenue or an alley with a tall building on the other side. The street side is a little noisier, but better view (not much view tho, when you're only 11 floors up). Everyone who works there who we encountered was pleasant and helpful. In the evening, someone is stationed near the elevator to make sure people going up have a room key.
reviews.title: What we expect from a Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Request a room as high up as possible and away from the ice machine. The included breakfast is available from 6-10am, but from 8:30-10, at least on weekends, the breakfast room is a polite but crowded zoo. Get there early, even if you plan to take your juice and bagel back to your room. We left our bags with the bellhop to hold between check out and the train home. With our AAA rate, the king room was under $200 a night (excluding taxes) on a cold, cold January weekend.
reviews.title: Good value but poor soundproofing

likes.disliked: — Bad soundproofing between bedrooms; poky bathroom

reviews.title: Ultra friendly staff, great location, clean rooms, great value, LOVED it!
reviews.text: This hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Times Square, and many other locations. The staff here is so pleasant, friendly and helpful (except for one of the concierges who I found to be very standoffish and he knows who he is). The free breakfast was excellent, even though very busy at times, the food was well stocked and the room clean no matter what time we went down. Traveling w/2 hungry "kids" (an 18 year old girl and 20 year old boy) the free breakfast saved us at least $20 a day if not more. The rooms were spacious (by NYC standards) and clean. We had no complaints whatsover. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are traveling with a family.

reviews.title: An excellent NYC hotel
reviews.text: This is the first hotel that I look  to for a reservation when going to NYC. You cannot find a better value in  all of NYC. Accomidations, staff, and ammenities are of  an excellent quality. We always look forward to staying at the Hampton Inn North.During our last stay, a request  to replace a TV remote was accomplised in less than 10 minutes, and followed up with a call to our room to see if the remote had arrived and was working properly. This type of service is the norm at this hotel. We will be returning in late Sept, and looking forward to our stay.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: We went there for vacation in the Big Apple, The first room we were given was right by the elevator we immediately called down stairs and they changed us to a lovely room far away from the elevators. The rooms were well kept, the staff was excellent and the location was great. I would definately recommend this hotel to all my friends and I would definately stay there again.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel at a great price!
reviews.text: 4 adult ladies stayed here from May 17th to May 21st. We checked in at 12:30pm and our room was ready even though check in wasn't until 3pm. We used valet parking at the adjacent lot and it cost $40/24 hrs for my SUV. Very convenient with all our luggage. I wouldn't do it any other way.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: The room was spacious by NYC standards, very clean and had 2 queen beds. The lobby was spacious and offered a concierge (which we never used), hot chocolate, coffee, tea and apples all day long/night. The buffet breakfast was good and plentiful and we didn't have an issue getting a table at all. The staff came around and offered us mints and asked if our stay was pleasant and if we had any concerns or complaints to please let them know so they could make it right. We paid $201.75USD/night plus NYC state taxes. The beds were comfortable, lofty white duvets, clean sheets every day. We met a couple from Dubai that were staying at Milford Plaza and they were very envious of our awesome hotel experience as theirs was terrible!

This hotel makes you immediately feel welcome. The 24 hour beverage service was excellent and the morning breakfast was sufficient with plenty of choices and refreshed and restocked continuously. The staff was friendly and efficient. we will choose this hotel again and again for our stay in NYC.
reviews.title: Perfect location and experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many horror stories about undersized rooms and poor service in the Times Square area , my wife and I were very pleasantly surprised by our accomodations at the Hampton Inn. The room was full size, very clean and everything was well maintained. From check-in to check-out, every staff member we encountered could not have been more helpful or pleasant. The only issue we had was getting internet service for my iPad - the problem was specific to the iPad. Overall a very good experience that I would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: The service was excellent

reviews.text: Efficient, friendly staff. Clean room, central location. Cheryl in housekeeping was fantastic. Will stay there every time I go to New York!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Time Square North from November 25 – November 30, 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed our vacation. All of the staff at this hotel went out of their way to make us feel at home and went above and beyond our expectations to ensure our stay was comfortable. We arrived very early on Thanksgiving trying to make the Macy’s Day Parade. I had spoken to the Guest Service Manager prior to our arrival and was happy to meet her while checking in. She offered to store our luggage and even placed our passports and valuables in a safe until our room was ready and even delivered a gift and balloons to our room for our son’s birthday. The information desk was always available to assist in restaurant recommendations and to make suggestions of things to see and do. The guestrooms were very clean and the housekeeper who cleaned our room did a great job every day, even leaving a small snack for our son a few of the days. The hotel is very conveniently located and was an easy subway ride or walk to most of the tourist destinations we as a family were interested in seeing. I highly recommend this hotel and commend the hotel staff and management for making our stay a memorable one. You definitely have a dedicated team!
reviews.title: Great Times in NYC

reviews.text: Pros: Clean room; friendly service; hot buffet breakfast, tea and coffee 24 hours in lobby and internet included in room rate; located close to Times Square.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly centrally located hotel
Elevator Noise!
reviews.text: After reading the prevoius reviews I booked an overnight visit to this hotel. Overall the hotel is average. Please be warned get a room as far from the elevators as possible. Our room was two doors down and the noise was very disturbing. Honestly whenever the elevator was used it sounded like a bowling ball was going across the ceiling. I don't know if it was a mechanical problem or just on going. I called the front desk but the hotel was booked.

reviews.title: Perfect location; great hotel
reviews.text: I will try this hotel again in the future but I will make sure I am no where in the vicinity of the elevator!

reviews.title: Great location and spacious rooms!
reviews.text: My 3 sisters and I booked one room for our Sisters Weekend in late March. We liked everything about this Hampton; great staff, loved the location, good breakfast and 24/7 coffee/tea! Hotel is only 2 years old so everything felt new and clean; beds were roomy and very comfy. We easily walked to St. Patrick's Cathedral, the TKTS booth, restaurants, stores and the theatre with absolutely no problem. Liked it so much that I'm planning to take my granddaughter there for a weekend later in the year....just perfect.

reviews.title: Fabulous find. Will stay again.
reviews.text: My mom, my two daughters and I spent 5 nights in NYC for the first time. We had read the great reviews for this hotel and they were so right. This Hampton Inn is a terrific value for NYC. The rooms were very spacious, beds and bed linens were very comfortable and the location is so convenient to everything a NYC sightseer would need. Here are some of the great things about this hotel:

reviews.title: Loved NYC and the Hampton Inn Times Square
reviews.text: The room: Loved that fact that our room had 2 QUEEN beds (not just 2 double/full size) so we could spread out and sleep comfortably. The linens, pillows and comforter were very soft and luxurious. Each bed had 3 pillows. There was a spacious desk and nice desk chair, chair and ottoman and a dresser and nightstand. Probably my only complaint about the room would be the lack of drawer space (only 3). The bathroom was very nice with granite counters and two open shelves below the sink for toiletry storage. Water pressure was always good. Shampoo/conditioner/lotion/soap was always restocked. We were on the 3rd floor with a view of 8th Ave which was great for people watching. I think all the even number rooms face 8th Ave.

My two friends and I recently took a girlfriend trip to NY, NY. We stayed at the Hampton Inn, Manhattan Times Square North and were very pleased with the attention and friendly service we received. Everyone we dealt with was more than happy to guide and pamper us, including the employees that checked us in and out, the concierges, the bellhops, and the restaurant staff. We had a chance to observe the manager and couldn't help but notice how she was a hands on manager that was working hard to make sure all was running smoothly. The hotel is in a great location and served our needs very well. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a roomy hotel that serves a good breakfast and is close to all the action.
reviews.title: Excellent experience!

reviews.text: My wife and I brought our 2 granddaughters (ages 13 and 20) to NYC for touring and a show. We are long-time Hampton and Honors guests in many areas, so we trust Hampton Inns to be OK. This stay was excellent in all respects...from the time we checked in until our check-out 4 days later. We will definitely stay again and recommend it to our friends. The location is wonderful...within walking distance of theaters, restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Thanks, Hampton Inn for your large part in making our NYC experience one we will not forget.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.text: This Hampton Inn is a great location. Easy walk to everything; theaters, Times Square, 30 Rock, Central Park! Found several good value restaurants on 8th Ave. Breakfast at hotel was plentiful: waffles, sausage, yogurt, eggs, cereal, bagels, sweet rolls, juice and the BEST coffee! I liked the regular coffee, my husband liked the robust coffee. Our rooms were CLEAN and spacious (for NYC) and beds were very comfy. Each bed had a choice of pillows, flat or puffy.
reviews.title: perfect vacation location

reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2010 with two teenagers. We did lots of research beforehand as we wanted a larger room with queen size beds. We were not disappointed. The hotel was clean, well located and the staff were friendly. The room was a good size and the air conditioning worked great during the heat wave. The free wifi worked well in the room and our second floor room on the back was quiet. Breakfast is included and had all the basics which was enough to get us going for the day. We paid approx $30 for a taxi ride from LaGuardia to the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Trip

reviews.text: The negatives: the two elevators are not enough but you won't wait longer than a minute or two. We were lucky being on the second floor so we took the stairs most of the time. The line-up for the breakfast can be long between 9-10am but the staff bring out OJ for you while you wait. The secret is to get up half an hour earlier and take breakfast up to your still sleeping teenagers.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel with excellent location, most of NY sights are within walking distance and easy to reach. Modern, well equiped rooms with 8th Avenue view. Hotel features a fitness centre. Good location for business travellers too.
reviews.title: Excellent property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed over New Year's weekend. I am a fan of Hampton Inns in general, and this is one of the best. Great room - spacious, quiet. Great staff - courteous and nice. Great breakfast. Easy location to get to the theater district or pretty much anywhere. Hotel full of couples, families, etc. - even some kids partying for New Years - but couldn't hear anything in the room.
reviews.title: One of the best places to stay in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, I had a very pleasant and helpful person to help me making my reservations. All personnel were helpful and courteous. The rooms were big enough to be comfortable. The complementary breakfasts were good and had some healthy choices. The weather was cold and the free coffee and hot chocolate was great. I thought the location was great and the hotel was a good value as compared to other choices. I would have enjoyed a computer room to check my e-mails. The hotel had only two guess computers (which were not user friendly) in a hallway. However, I do realize this is the day when most guess probably bring their own. I would definitely stay here again if I am in New York City.
reviews.title: Great value for location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For NYC, this hotel offered a large, clean, modern room at an affordable price. The bathroom was a decent size and, most importantly, it was also clean. The hotel itself is in a good area, walking distance to everything and far enough away from Times Square that you don't actually have to deal with Times Square. I've spent a great deal more money on hotels with smaller, dirtier rooms...and now I can't imagine staying anywhere else. If you are the type of person who needs lots of bells and whistles and room service, etc. then maybe this hotel isn't for you - but, in my opinion, why would you need any of that while you're in NYC? I think this hotel is a great value.
reviews.title: Great room and location - can't beat the price!

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this particular hotel. I chose it again because it had queen beds & four of us ladies were sharing. I must add the staff at the hotel are the best. Friendly, courteous, professional & accomodating. Plus it is so convenient to the theatre district you won't require public transportation getting there. Breakfast is included with a wide selection of breakfast foods plus there is coffee, tea & hot chocolate available 24 hrs. Cookies are served every afternoon at 3pm. The hotel is within blocks of Times Square but far enough away so that you avoid the noise associated in that area. The hotel was very quiet & we really got a good nights sleep all 3 nights there. I spoke to Wilbur who I recognized from last year & told him I would always return to the hotel for any stay in NYC because of it's location & because of the staff. That can really make a difference in an enjoyable hotel stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to Times Square

reviews.text: There is plenty of choice of places to eat close by including a great pizza shop directly opposite and a 24 hour diner. Breakfast is included in the price of the rooms and is very good. There is free tea and coffee in the reception at all times and the staff even put free cookies out in the afternoons.
reviews.title: Simply fantastic

reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: great for groups

reviews.text: The only critisism is the same as a lot of other people have mentioned: there are only two lifts for the whole building and these can get really busy in the mornings when lots of people are checking out. Also the breakfast area gets really crowded in the mornings.
reviews.title: Great stay
Just okay
reviews.text: We just returned from a five night stay at Hampton Inn - Manhattan Times Square North. The hotel is in a good location, right across from two of the most popular broadway shows and near many restaurants. The rooms are an average size, fairly clean, and the beds are comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elevators are slow, slow, slow, so it is not the place to be if you are on a tight schedule. I walked downstairs from the 11th floor because I was late and could not wait the ten minutes required on a busy morning. I wasn't alone, there were many others doing the same thing.
reviews.title: Staff was excellent

reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and 2 young children mid-week. Hotel is in a great location, close enough to mid-town attractions (Times Square, Radio City, Broadway, Central Park) but far enough off the beaten path. NYC subway one block away so you can be anywhere in the city in 20 minutes. Staff could not have been more accommodating to our needs (early check-in, bag storage, late checkout). NIce size rooms; we had two queen beds. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Parking garage right next door offers a discount for hotel guests. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a must if you want a great location with out braking the bank, fantastic helpful staff on reception, good standard clean rooms,very fresh adiquate breakfast quick and easy, loads of tea coffeee, hot choc free, this is a gem of a hotel in New York.
reviews.title: Great little Hotel

reviews.text: Location i repeat is SUPERB.
reviews.title: WOW - What a find ...

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for 4 nights and could not have asked for better service or friendler staff. Everyone goes out of their way to help in anyway possible.
reviews.title: Good location - decent size room

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to all the attractions, Times Square being a 5-10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Everything I Hoped For and More
Brilliant
reviews.text: We are just back from New York and we stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square North. What a fantastic hotel, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, apples and cookies are available 24/7 you just help yourself. It is also very clean and the beds are so comfortable, we were on the 10th floor and we could not have asked for better accomodation. Complementary breakfast was good too, not too keen on the hot dishes , but plenty of fruit, juice,toast ,bagels and muffins so there is something for everyone. The hotel is close to everything, as you come out of the hotel door turn left and walk straight up the street and you are at Columbus Circle at the beginning of Central Park, the park itself is beautiful, with lots to see it is worth taking a bike trip with one of the guides, we would recommend Kenny from the Gambia, he told us everything about the park and it was really interesting, once you have been on the bike ride you know exactly where to go and spend time at your favourite parts of the park. Also turn right from the hotel door and walk one block, cross to the left carry on down the street and you are in the middle of Times Square and Theatre Land so close to everything. If you are looking for good food and friendly staff I strongly recommend the Harmony View bar & grill which is situated between Broadway and 8th Avenue. This was our first trip to New York and it was fantastic, the weather was lovely too. Gail and Robert Irvine 1st May 2007

reviews.title: quite decent experience at Hampton Inn
reviews.text: Just back from a three night stay with our two teens. Outside of building is non-descript, and 8th Avenue is a little mixed, but the inside of this hotel is really nice -- very clean, just renovated. And we're picky! We found our room clean, well equipped, and quite quiet given the location. We shared one room as a family of 4 in a room with 2 queen beds. A little squishy, but roomier than Sheraton Towers where we stayed last year. Convenient to theater and Times Square. Breakfast was included -- the hot stuff was icky, but cereal, bagels, toast, etc. was just fine. My only criticism was that the coffee was really weak, and that they use very environmentally unfriendly seeming styrofoam plates and cups to avoid dishwashing, etc. All in all, a great spot -- I hope they start to use recycled paper dishes at some point?!

reviews.title: Recommend this hotel
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on previous reviews and we were not disappointed. It is in a great location for sightseeing and of course shopping.

This hotel offered a great room at a great value, right in the Times Square area. The location is within walking distance to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway, the heart of the activity in busy Times Square, and shopping.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with exceptional service, even through Christmas blizzard

reviews.text: We spent Christmas day there and the next day the "Christmas 2010 Blizzard" arrived. NYC was basically crippled for two days due to impassable roadways and the shutting down of public transportation. The hotel staff was still accommodating even though the majority of their staff was unable to come to work. The employees who were already at work stayed there and worked around the clock taking care of guests' needs. They continued to provide free hot beverages and the free hot daily breakfast was much appreciated. Every time we walked through the hotel lobby, a worker was busy cleaning the floor. The bellmen were exceptionally helpful to us during our stay.
reviews.title: Large quiet rooms and pretty good location
great choice for cost and location
reviews.text: The room itself was large by NYC standards, and modern and clean. I am very picky about hotel bathroom cleanliness, and this hotel bathroom was spotless. The bathroom isn't huge but it had ample counter space and shelves underneath the sink that provide storage. The water pressure was good and the water was nice and hot even with freezing temperatures outside.

reviews.title: average hotel, good location
reviews.text: The hotel does not have an on-site restaurant but it was not an issue at all for us. It is within walking distance to some great restaurants and with the free breakfast and hot beverages, we never felt a need for anything more. We really have no complaints about this hotel at all, and the next time we visit NYC this is where we will stay.

We stayed at this Hilton with free points. The room was large (for NYC) and clean. We never heard another room or the noise outside our window, other than an occasional ambulance. We never went to the breakfast as it always seemed pretty packed, but did enjoy the daily coffee / hot tea/ cocoa that was available in the lobby all day. Service was excellent and staff very friendly and helpful. We did a lot of walking, but location not too bad and close to subway.
reviews.title: Time to redesign the breakfast setup

aka: The Hampton Inn Times Square North Hotel
description: Best Times Square location with COMPLIMENTARY amenities including daily hot breakfast, Internet, fitness center, business center & more! Hampton Inn® Manhattan Times Square North is a newly renovated, contemporary hotel with ideal Times Square location that is steps from Broadway theaters, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, TKTS discount theater ticket booth, The Museum of Modern Art, Carnegie Hall and Restaurant Row. Located on Eighth Avenue at 51st Street in the heart of Times Square, the hotel is surrounded by many restaurants, lively nightlife, shopping and New York City’s best sightseeing. The hotel is close to all major subway lines, a few blocks from Jacob Javits Convention Center and Port Authority Bus Terminal plus is convenient to all (3) area airports.The hotel features 300 oversized, modern guestrooms each equipped with 32-inch LCD flat panel television, lap desk, large work desk with ergonomic chair and Cloud Nine, the Hampton Bed Experience. COMPLIMENTARY, HOT BREAKFAST is offered daily to each guest plus On the Run Breakfast Bags™ are available from the front desk Monday through Friday, for guests who are “on-the-go.” Additional complimentary amenities include high-speed lobby and guestroom Internet access, 24-hour Business Center, 24-hour Fitness Center, coffee and tea in the lobby 24 hours per day, local telephone calls from guestroom and complimentary USA Today® (Monday through Friday). Hampton Inn® Manhattan Times Square North also has a gift shop and full-service Concierge/Theater Ticket Desk onsite. The hotel is 100% non-smoking. Valet parking is available. The hotel allows service pets. 24-hour Security onsite.
